abstract: Michelle Obama, in wearing traditionally feminine clothing during Asian tour to promote women's education, may have signaled that femininity and power are not at odds with one another.
lead_paragraph: In wearing shapes that recall the ’50s on her Asian tour, Michelle Obama may have showed girls that in confronting a stereotype, you negate its power.

headline.main: For Michelle Obama, Girlie Clothes That Lean In

snippet: In wearing shapes that recall the ’50s on her Asian tour, Michelle Obama may have showed girls that in confronting a stereotype, you negate its power.

keywords.value: Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead (Book)
